noun.description: An official who examines material that is about to be released, such as books, movies, news, and art, and suppresses any parts that are considered obscene, politically unacceptable, or a threat to security.
(in ancient Rome) either of two magistrates who held censuses and supervised public morals.

verb.description: Examine (a book, movie, etc.) officially and suppress unacceptable parts of it.

origin: Mid 16th century (in censor (sense 2 of the noun)): from Latin, from censere assess.
